availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George W. Howe (Franklin County, Kentucky, wagon maker, postmaster, and justice of the peace)

body.p: Franklin County, Kentucky, wagon maker, postmaster, and justice of the peace. Kentucky native. Father of Matilda Howe, Edward Howe, John H. Howe, and Charles Howe. Married to Rebecca Newman Howe in Scott County, Kentucky, on November 11, 1841. Father of Nancy Howe, George William Howe, Francis Howe, and Robert Howe. Resident in Scott County in 1830. Owned five enslaved persons in Scott County in 1830. Resident in Scott County in 1840. Wagon maker in Franklin County, Kentucky, in 1850. U.S. postmaster in Franklin County in 1851. Wagon maker in Franklin County in 1860. Justice of the Peace in Franklin County in 1861.

ab.bibl:

Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Mortality Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Forks of Elkhorn, p. 325.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Scott County Marriages, Film #000183225.
Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971 Records of the Post Office Department, NARA Series M841, RG 28, Franklin County, Kentucky, vol. 14.
KYR-0001-017-0186.
